issue.title: HACKHACK: strict null checks issues
issue.body:
- [x] core: `removeEventListener` not inferring / allowing narrowing type of `event` param in handler (https://github.com/palantir/blueprint/pull/5234)
- [x] core, table: casting `react-lifecycles-compat` polyfill, e.g. `@(polyfill as Utils.LifecycleCompatPolyfill<ITabsProps, any>)` (#4545)
- [x] docs-theme: default tag renderers narrow typing prevents `Heading` component from declaring additional props data dependencies

pull_request.title: Upgrade to TypeScript v5.2
pull_request.body:
Fixes #4342

✅ Prerequisites:

- [x] https://github.com/palantir/blueprint/pull/6478
- [x] https://github.com/palantir/documentalist/pull/156

#### Changes proposed in this pull request:

- Upgrade from TypeScript v4.8 to v5.2
- Refactor tsconfig files to extend from two possible base configs, `tsconfig.web.json` and `tsconfig.node.json`
- Remove deprecated `importsNotUsedAsValues` config option, enable [`verbatimModuleSyntax`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-5-0.html#--verbatimmodulesyntax) instead
- Upgrade to `@documentalist/compiler` and `@documentalist/client` v5.0.0 to use the latest TypeDoc library
- Implement workarounds for various Documentalist regressions:
  - https://github.com/palantir/documentalist/issues/246
  - https://github.com/palantir/documentalist/issues/245
  - https://github.com/palantir/documentalist/issues/248

#### Reviewers should focus on:

- TypeScript config changes
- Documentation changes resulting from a major TypeDoc upgrade
- Not sure if this will require Documentalist to also bump to marked v9.0, as that was missed in v5.0: https://github.com/palantir/documentalist/pull/247

#### Notes

See TypeScript release notes:

- [TypeScript 4.9](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-4-9.html)
- [TypeScript 5.0](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-5-0.html)
- [TypeScript 5.1](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-5-1.html)
- [TypeScript 5.2](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/release-notes/typescript-5-2.html)

review.body: looks like my attempt to parallelize the CI job didn't work. docs-data needs all the libraries to be compiled so that it can create TS programs from all the output definition files. will need another approach.

issue.title: Help Wanted: Using transitionName in Dialog component
issue.body:
Hello - I am trying to use the transitionName prop in the Dialog component. I was wondering if there are any examples or documentation on using this property. Specifically I am looking for guidance on doing this ([from the docs](http://blueprintjs.com/docs/v2/#core/components/dialog.css-api)): 

> Providing your own name here will require defining new CSS transition properties.

Thank You!

issue.title: Help Wanted: Using transitionName in Dialog component
issue.body:
Hello - I am trying to use the transitionName prop in the Dialog component. I was wondering if there are any examples or documentation on using this property. Specifically I am looking for guidance on doing this ([from the docs](http://blueprintjs.com/docs/v2/#core/components/dialog.css-api)): 

> Providing your own name here will require defining new CSS transition properties.

Thank You!

comment.body: @dylangrandmont thanks for posting your snippet. I agreed, we could use better docs about "customizing CSS transitions" on Blueprint components.

commits.message: don't match triple backtick code block fences
move class namespace interpolation to hooks; remove core & docs-theme deps

issue.title: How can make left to right transition of dialog when opening?
issue.body:
#### Environment

"react": "^16.4.1",
"@blueprintjs/core": "^3.0.1",
"@blueprintjs/datetime": "^3.0.0",
"@blueprintjs/select": "^3.0.0",

#### Question
I would like to make a specific left to right animation when dialog is opening. 
I read the document has `transitionName` prop. How can I use that or give me some example/ code?

comment.body: In case anyone else encounters this, hopefully my comment on a similar issue is useful https://github.com/palantir/blueprint/issues/2449#issuecomment-1780091787

issue.title: Help Wanted: Using transitionName in Dialog component
issue.body:
Hello - I am trying to use the transitionName prop in the Dialog component. I was wondering if there are any examples or documentation on using this property. Specifically I am looking for guidance on doing this ([from the docs](http://blueprintjs.com/docs/v2/#core/components/dialog.css-api)): 

> Providing your own name here will require defining new CSS transition properties.

Thank You!
